Class Board

java.lang.Object
sudoku.Board
public class Board extends Object
Mutable SIZExSIZE Sudoku board. Holds cell values, enforces in-bounds access, and provides row/column/box legality checks.

Digits are 1–SIZE; 0 means empty. SIZE is the single source of truth for board dimensions.

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    static final int
    SIZE
    Board width/height (9 for a standard Sudoku).

  • Field Details

    • SIZE

      public static final int SIZE
      Board width/height (9 for a standard Sudoku).
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

  • Constructor Details

    • Board

      public Board(int[][] start)
      Construct a SIZE×SIZE Sudoku board from an initial value matrix. Digits 1..SIZE become givens; 0 becomes an empty editable cell.

      Preconditions: start must be a SIZE×SIZE array whose elements are in 0..SIZE. Values > 0 are treated as fixed givens.

      Parameters:
      start - initial values, row-major (size SIZE×SIZE; 0 for empty)

  • Method Details

    • cell

      public Cell cell(int r, int c)
      Get the Cell at (r,c).
      Parameters:
      r - row index 0..SIZE-1
      c - column index 0..SIZE-1
      Returns:
      the cell object at the given coordinates (never null)
      Throws:
      ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if out of bounds

    • inBounds

      public boolean inBounds(int r, int c)
      Check whether (r,c) lies within the board.
      Parameters:
      r - row index
      c - column index
      Returns:
      true if 0 ≤ r,c < SIZE

    • isValidPlacement

      public boolean isValidPlacement(int r, int c, int v)
      Test whether placing v at (r,c) is legal under Sudoku rules. Does not mutate the board.
      Parameters:
      r - row 0..SIZE-1
      c - col 0..SIZE-1
      v - digit 1..SIZE
      Returns:
      true if no row, column, or 3x3 box conflict
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if v is out of range

    • trySet

      public boolean trySet(int r, int c, int v)
      Try to set v at (r,c) if the placement is legal and the cell is editable.
      Parameters:
      r - row 0..SIZE-1
      c - col 0..SIZE-1
      v - digit 1..SIZE
      Returns:
      true if the value was set; false otherwise

    • tryClear

      public boolean tryClear(int r, int c)
      Try to clear the value at (r,c) if the cell is editable.
      Parameters:
      r - row 0..SIZE-1
      c - col 0..SIZE-1
      Returns:
      true if the cell was cleared; false otherwise

    • isSolved

      public boolean isSolved()
      Check if puzzle has been solved.
      Returns:
      true if all cells are nonzero and the grid is internally consistent (no duplicates in any row, column, or box)

    • fromString

      public static Board fromString(String s)
      Build a board from an (SIZExSIZE)-character string (row-major). Digits 1..SIZE set givens; 0 or '.' mean empty.
      Parameters:
      s - (SIZExSIZE) characters of [0-SIZE.] in row-major order
      Returns:
      a new board with those initial values
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the string length/content is invalid
